candidates.name: CSV Cleaner for Small Businesses
candidates.description: A web tool that fixes messy CSVs (dates, currency, duplicates) and outputs clean imports for QuickBooks/Shopify/Sheets. Includes templates per destination.
candidates.wedge: Instead of a full ETL product, it’s a one-purpose ‘make this import work’ tool with destination templates and instant preview.
candidates.mvp_in:
• Upload CSV
• 6 common fixes
• Preview table
• Export cleaned CSV
• 3 destination templates
candidates.mvp_out:
• API connectors
• Team collaboration
• Automation schedules
candidates.first10_steps:
1) Create SEO landing pages per destination
2) Run $10/day on intent keywords
3) Add freemium limit
4) Convert via $9 one-time or $5/mo
candidates.keywords_checked: fix csv import; clean csv quickbooks; shopify csv errors
candidates.serp_notes: Tools vs Blogs: mixed; Ads: unknown; Some tool intent; lots of help articles

voc_quotes.quote: I keep getting import errors and I don’t know what’s wrong with my CSV.
I just want a tool that tells me what to fix and lets me download a clean file.
I only need this once in a while, not a monthly subscription.

candidates.assumptions: Occasional use fits one-time pricing; templates increase success rate.
candidates.risks:
• Handling sensitive data
• Free competitors
• Trust barrier for uploads
candidates.notes: Add privacy messaging; consider local-only processing later.

candidates.name: Instant Quote Widget for Local Services
candidates.description: A drop-in website widget that gives instant ballpark quotes for common services (junk removal, detailing, landscaping) and captures phone/email. Sends the lead to SMS instantly.
candidates.wedge: Most quote tools are complex; this is a 10-minute setup widget with 3 templates and an SMS-first workflow for faster close rates.
candidates.mvp_in:
• 3 vertical templates
• Embed script
• Quote rules editor
• SMS + email lead delivery
• Simple admin dashboard
candidates.first10_steps:
1) Build 1-page demo
2) Offer 10 free installs
3) Convert to $49/mo after 14 days
4) Collect testimonials
candidates.keywords_checked: instant quote widget; estimate widget; lead capture widget
candidates.serp_notes: Tools vs Blogs: tools; Ads: unknown; Strong tool intent; many SaaS pages

competitors.name: Calconic
competitors.gap: Builder is powerful but setup friction

voc_quotes.quote: People ask for prices and never fill out my contact form.
If I could text them a quote instantly I’d book more jobs.
I don’t want a full CRM, just a simple estimator widget.

candidates.assumptions: SMBs pay if it clearly increases leads; SMS delivery is key differentiator.
candidates.risks:
• Compliance for SMS
• Many incumbents
• SMB churn if no ROI
candidates.notes: Needs real VoC quotes + proof of SMB willingness to pay.

candidates.name: Tab Sweeper for Work Sessions
candidates.description: A Chrome extension that auto-groups and hibernates tabs by project with one-click restore. It shows a simple weekly ‘time saved’ dashboard so users feel the payoff.
candidates.wedge: Unlike heavy tab managers, it’s one-button ‘clean my session’ with zero setup and a weekly savings score that makes the habit stick.
candidates.mvp_in:
• One-click sweep
• Auto-group by domain
• Hibernation
• Restore last 3 sessions
• Weekly time-saved estimate
candidates.mvp_out:
• Team features
• Cross-device sync
• AI categorization
candidates.first10_steps:
1) Ship free basic version
2) Post on r/chrome_extensions and productivity subs
3) Offer 50 beta codes for Pro
4) Ask for reviews
candidates.keywords_checked: tab hibernation extension; reduce tabs chrome; tab manager simple
candidates.serp_notes: Tools vs Blogs: mixed; Ads: unknown; Some tools, many blog posts; extension intent exists

competitors.name: The Great Suspender
competitors.gap: No ‘session sweep’ + no savings feedback loop

competitors.name: OneTab
competitors.gap: Batch list only; no auto-group + no restore UX

competitors.name: Workona
competitors.gap: Too heavy; setup friction for casual users

voc_quotes.quote: My tabs get out of control and it kills my focus.
I want something simple that just closes or sleeps tabs automatically.
Most tab managers feel like a whole project to set up.

candidates.assumptions:
Users will pay small fee for ‘set and forget’ + visible time saved.
Chrome store discovery + Reddit can seed first users.
candidates.risks:
• Chrome policy changes
• Competing free tools
• Retention if ‘time saved’ feels fake
candidates.notes: Replace VoC + competitor links with real sources during research.
